headline: The S&P 500's most volatile stocks in 2024
summary: Looking back on 2024, the year saw monumental gains across the major indexes (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) while still proving to be a roller coaster ride of volatility for several individual stocks. The Morning Brief anchors Seana Smith and Madison Mills take a look at several of the S&P 500's most volatile names in 2024, including Palantir Technologies (PLTR), Tesla (TSLA), Enphase Energy (ENPH), and Super Micro Computer (SMCI) after its shares plummeted, tied to the resignation of its auditor. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.
